back: An $m \times n$ matrix $\mathbf{A}$ is tall if $m >n$; i.e., the number of rows is greater than the number of columns.
An $m \times n$ matrix $\mathbf{A}$ is wide if $n > m$; i.e., the number of columns is greater than the number of rows.

For an $m \times n$ matrix real $\mathbf{A}$ with $m>n$ (i.e., $\mathbf{A}$ is tall) and linearly independent columns, the Moore-Penrose pseudoinverse of $\mathbf{A}$ is denoted by $\mathbf{A}^\dagger$ and given by \begin{equation*} \mathbf{A}^\dagger = ( \mathbf{A}^T \mathbf{A})^{-1} \mathbf{A}^T \end{equation*}
For a system of linear equations $\mathbf{A}\mathbf{x} = \mathbf{b}$, OLS gives the $\mathbf{X}$ that minimizes the norm of the error, $$ \hat{\mathbf{x}} =  \mathbf{A}^\dagger \mathbf{b}.$$
Regression that finds a linear relation between multiple explanatory variables and the response variable.
